subject: RE: [junit] Testing Private Methods
msgSnippet: Mike, Feel free to browse the archives of this list.  There are quite a few threads on the issue.  But to give you a quick reference, if you feel you must test
messageBody:
Mike,

Feel free to browse the archives of this list. There are quite a few
threads on the issue. But to give you a quick reference, if you feel you
must test private and package-protected, you can use JUnitX.

-Jason

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Mike Witters [mailto:mikew@...]
> Sent: Thursday, June 28, 2001 9:06 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Testing Private Methods
>
>
> Hello.
>
> Can anyone point me to a good source of information on
> using JUNIT for
> testing private methods and package-protected methods.
> It seems like its
> not going to be possible to do it while separating the
> TestCase classes and
> the business object classes.
>
> One of the reasons I see a difficulty is that we are
> using VisualAge for
> Java and it would make it a deployment nightmare to
> include the code in the
> same packages or, worse yet, the same classes. I know
> that there are
> options I could use outside of VA such as ANT to only
> build certain classes,
> but I doubt I could get the client to buy into that and I
> still don't think
> that solves the private method issue.
>
> Am I just missing something easy or what?
>
> Thanks,
> Mike
>
>
